channel.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
channel.description:
Draft thing I've pulled from the back-burner and plan to push through to finish.
[(Artist TBC) - Creep (Draft. Genre?, Minimal Melodic Techno?)](https://soundcloud.com/heathenaka/creep-draft/s-OLoyD)
  Sketch/draft status. Plan to keep direct it as a stripped down minimal banger, though still needs a B section in the middle.
Thoughts welcome – especially from resident house and technoheads @blakkaz and @NickElle. Input on genre welcome.
Slightly funky minimal(?)
Minimal House? Melodic Deep Techno? Minimal Melodic?
:man_shrugging:

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
NickElle:

I find that hard to believe it’s Techno, if it’s at 90.
It may be just Bass music, at that point.

Are you saying techno can’t exist at 90bpm?

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
NickElle:

Also, I really like the track. It’s super nice.
I’d like to get it for my own collection, if possible.

Cheers. For sure.
Need to spend some more time on it first. As mentioned, needs a B-Section for a bit of mid-track contrast/relief.

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks. I wanted it to be a bit dark, but still danceable.

‘Groovy’, but with those subtle, but increasingly detuned/dissonant chords underneath hits a nice vibe with relatively few moving parts.

A little too hard to be (straight) House, a little too swung to be (straight) Techno.

The slower tempo is because I wanted it to have a bit of a swing/skip, rather than be too driving, if you know what I mean.

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Also, as a DJ myself, I would most likely look over this track, if I were playing Techno in a set.
I know that I can speed it up, but most (good) DJs tend not change the tempo that drastically because it causes warping.

But, on the other hand, I could play this track in a Tech House set. You know, maybe as a midset break from the bangers.
Or midset dark track in a Deep House set.

Also, I really like the track. It’s super nice.
I’d like to get it for my own collection, if possible.

Read full topic

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

I really do struggle to give credibility to the idea that playing a techno track at 120bpm stops it being techno, despite being the same in every other way than tempo.

Yep. Agree 100%.

I have techno records at 90 bpm, and others at 150.

Read full topic

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
NickElle:

Techno has been at 130-140 for a minute.

That depends what techno you listen to.

akabillposters:

What genre(s) would you both consider Eagerleave’s Famas track?

If I worked in a record store, I think I’d probably file it under ‘bass’.

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I guess I just revolutionised Techno, then.
Or, maybe that should be ‘de’-volutionised.

I really do struggle to give credibility to the idea that playing a techno track at 120bpm stops it being techno, despite being the same in every other way than tempo.

I understand DJ/club tastes might have moved towards a slightly faster tempo, but surely entire genres aren’t dependent on DJ/club-friendliness.

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.description:
Oh, nooo.
Techno has been at 130-140 for a minute.
That’s quite a jump.

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

Perhaps it’s a fusion of Microhouse plus that something else.

It does remind me of the pre-minimal deep-tech stuff that was popular in the 00s.
Stuff like Booka Shade.

MANDY vs Booka Shade - Body Language
Booka Shade - Night Falls
Booka Shade - In White Rooms

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
It’s important in the playback, but not the creation.

I prefer to not let commercial practicalities steer my creative process.
It either finds an audience – or it doesn’t.

(I’m also sure there are enough techno DJs out there open to pushing the envelope a little by playing material a little outside the norm.
Not that pushing it up from 114 to 120 [+5%] is going to test any DJs.)

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Just checked some out. (Used to listen to it years ago, which is probably where I’m dragging this penchant up from.)
Seems to be close, though maybe there’s another genre that represents the other half of the fusion (i.e. the hooky, bouncy, melodic part).

Perhaps it’s a fusion of Microhouse plus that something else.

Thanks.

 

 
Spiritually, I think it’s in the same hemi-sphere as Eagerleave’s Famas track. A minimal bouncer with a subtly hard edge.

…imo. (though the fantastic Famas piece is extremely stripped back)

S/he has that tagged simply as Dance & EDM, which would speak in the most general terms. I can certainly add that to the stack, but it would good to get a little more granular.

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Tempo is actually very important.
It’s important because DJs want to create a seamless mix with equal tempo.

Read full topic
item.source: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)

item.title: [Artist TBD] - Creep (Draft/WIP. Genre?, Minimal, Deep, Melodic, Techno?)
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Interesting. Thanks.

Tempo has always felt like one of those factors that can bend without necessarily breaking a genre (or creating a new one).
(I’ve never bought in to the notion that genres are tempo-restricted.)

e.g. Slow techno would still (presumably) be techno – otherwise, how do you evolve a genre (without necessarily trying to create a new one)?

Read full topic

It’s got too much melody for Techno, and it’s too slow for Techno, but I don’t know what genre it is for House.
